reviewText: Another excellent concert video from Steven Wilson - the songs, the band, the video and the sound on this blu-ray are incredible. For fans of Steven Wilson, no more needs to be said: you need to buy this. For anyone unfamiliar with Steven Wilson: you need to buy this!
summary: Get All You Deserve [Blu-ray] Steven Wilson

reviewText: What can I say but amazing. Saw the live show in Boston, and this certainly rivals the experience. I never wanted that show to end and I am soooo happy that this came out. Living it over again and again. Cannot get enough of all that I deserve! Sound, picture, musicianship are all on here. It blows me away every time I watch it. My only wish is that there was an alternate angle camera showing the whole stage thru out the show. The projections Lasse created are just mind blowing and I would have loved to fawn over them for hours.
summary: Are u kiddin me? This is Muzak!
Title: N/A

reviewText: As a big PTree fan, I was at first a little disappointed with Steven's solo work... I wanted him to quit screwing around and make another PTree record.  I must say he is winning me over... this concert blu-ray is simply stunning in every way.  Except for Marco Minneman, I'd never heard of any of these musicians, but they are all fantastic.  The guitarist (Niko Tsonev) in particular is a standout, I will have to check out more of his work.I'd only heard Grace for Drowning in stereo, but I see now why people were raving about the surround mix... this music really comes to life in 5.1.  My home theater has never sounded/looked this good.
summary: Spectacular musicianship and reference quality sound/visuals
Title: N/A

reviewText: Steven Wilson is probably the most creative musician around today. His output is consistently great, and at the same diverse enough to keep from getting old. And while it seems as if Porcupine Tree (his main band project) is on indefinite hold, Wilson continues on in a variety of directions. This concert DVD is basically a concert of Wilson's solo work (2 albums and another coming up in 2013). He's joined by some first class musician friends and the result is a concert experience of incredible quality. Personaly, I like Wilson's solo work, but I wasn't sure how it would translate to the live stage (especially the stuff from Grace For Drowning). In fact, the songs translate quite well. This show is Pink Floyd like at times with the dark but cerebral atmosphere, but then its more artsy. I wonder what it was like watching it live, particular with the sheer curtain between the band and crowd for the first third of the show! Marco Minnemann on the drums is world class and his performance is a true highlight! The rest of the band is very good as well. I hear that this is the band that Wilson is taking into the studio to record his 3rd solo album. It's supposed to be kinda jazzy. Overall, this is no doubt a five star performance. Interesting music presented in an interesting manner. I also noticed that Steven Wilson's stage presence is a bit different than when he's fronting Porcupine Tree. For example, what was with all the hand flutters and conducting manuevers!
summary: Awesome DVD, but what's with all the hand flutters!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is truly a performance that you need to watch several times, before you can really appreciate the musicianship and song-writing. It's a concert performance of "Grace for Drowning" which again is technically and musically a very accomplished project. The difference between this and PT albums is there's not so much (but some)of the heavier edge and cranking riffs that PT do so well. I highly recommend this DVD and album... just don't expect Deadwing or In Absentia. And the final song is (sorry SW) just a little TOO dark in parts.My only real beef is the use of a front stage scrim as a lighting effect for the first half hour. It mostly annoyed the hell out of me and I even fast-forwarded hoping it wasn't in place the entire concert. Once it's gone, vision is great. Sound is fantastic all the time.
summary: Excellent, but if you're a Porcupine Tree fan...

reviewText: This is one excellent box set (the one I got) with blu ray, dvd, and 2 cds. The concert was absolutely killer and I got to see some musicians I'd never heard before and can't remember their names, of course. They were all good. The music flowed throughout and the director did a wonderful job. Steven Wilson continues to create great music and he is one of the few contemporary musicians that I listen to and collect.

reviewText: If you are going to listen to a regular DVD on an Apple computer and you hear that the sound is floppy please follow this instructions to correct the mistake and get the full sound of this wonderful music.Go to DVD player > Preferences > Disc setup and check "Disable Dolby dynamic  range compression ."I had this problem and the cool thing is that this solution was provided by Steven Wilson himself because I wrote my concern about it here. Some people don't say anything but my ears don't lie.This is another flawless release from the talented  Mr Wilson  surrounded by a gang of talented musicians. Enjoy as much as I do and BUY IT!!!
summary: PLEASE READ THIS if you are having problems with the sound.

reviewText: I can not  recommend  "Get All You Deserve" highly enough!As a concert performance its equal to to any before or after in the landscape of music.The band gives what Steven Wilson wants a moment in space and time  to be heard and seen!While "Get All You Deserve" gives  a depth to the studio versions of the songs sonically and emotionally.Shows how Steven Wilson keeps the artist in him real while creating his art.The picture and sound quality (96/24 stereo) of the blu-ray only enhances this experience.(I use a Oppo BD 93 player for music only,  the audio is connect through the HiFi.)What came first the Grace For Drowning(the egg) or Get all You Deserve (the chicken)When "'Grace For Drowning " came out I bought both the CD and the Blu-ray edition. The  Blu-ray edition was  a visual connection to the album and the 96/24 stereo a slightly warmer  sound over the Cd.

reviewText: Steven Wilson is showing the most of his experimental side on his solo project. I got the impression that he can display his freedom more on this than with Porcupine Tree and Blackfield. By adding a lot more variety of keyboards sounds (mellotron, piano), sax and flute, we get more intriguing sounds that enchanted the music to something new and original. The 2 hours of music on this DVD is a journey through the mind of a genius that make you experience a wide range of atmosphere from the quiet part of a piano, the delicate vocals harmonies and the agression of a guitar exploding suddenly. Sometimes we are hearing the melancholic music of Blakfield, a lot of times, the heavy prog of Porcupine Tree, also, the mellotron, the sax and the flute take you back to the first King Crimson's era.The concert start slowly with some strange visual effects that are created with a curtain on the stage, that made the concert look like a old footage. The curtain is remove during the "Sectarian" song, so we can now have a clear view of all the members. And it seem to me that the show really takeoff here, with this excellent song. After the band go on to play some intense music, especially with "Postcard", the first time release track; "Luminol" and the epic, "Raider II".The DTS mix of Steven Wilson is another example of what his a perfect surround mix. The separation between all instruments is clear. You can hear different instruments in the rear speakers with a sound that is well balanced.This concert give you a new experience not only for the music, but for the visuals, very different from the Porcupine Tree's DVD. And it gets my highest recommendation!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is the best live concert DVD I have ever seen or heard! Speaking everything. Powerful musicianship, songwriting, visual light show, etc. with only the possible exception of Pink Floyd during the Obscured By Clouds/Dark Side Of The Moon era. I have been a Steven Wilson/Porcupine Tree fan since 1998 when I was first introduced to their music by a girl that I knew from Germany. He has really made his mark in the world of progressive/creative music, proving that by recently working with and remastering several of the King Crimson albums working with Robert Fripp himself, not to mention his remastering of some Jethro Tull albums as well. His own music projects with Porcupine Tree, No-Man, Blackfield, Storm Corrosion and Bass Communion have also deepend his insights and broadend his reach upon the masses. Here he shows himself to us without the use of another band. This is HIS band! All hand-picked by Steven. All songs are written by Steven. And he has chosen long-time Porcupine Tree artist Lasse Holie to help create the visuals as well as film the entire concert. The DVD title is exactly as stated. Steven has my highest regards as being one of the best in the world of music at present. So I must give this DVD my highest rating of 10 stars!!!! It just doesn't get any better than this!

reviewText: Assuming you already know you love this artist, let me just assure you the sonic and visuals are superb. An excellent capture of the best show of 2011. This was taped 4 short days after i saw them in Dallas, and it is the perfect souvenir of that great show. Especially, Luminol, the new track from the forthcoming album. It IS the highlight of the show; with Steven writing specifically to the talents of this touring band, a whole new side of SW emerges. Highly recommended.
